remarks:
Two ways to express the class of unique-valued arguments of ` F ` , which is the same as the domain of ` F ` whenever ` F ` is a function. The left-hand side of the equality is from Definition 10.2 of [Quine] p. 65.  Quine uses the notation "arg ` F ` " for this class (for which we have no separate notation).  Observe the resemblance to the alternative definition ~ dffv4 of function value, which is based on the idea in Quine's definition.  (Contributed by NM, 8-May-2005.)

args $p |- { x | E. y ( F " { x } ) = { y } } = { x | E! y x F y } $.
